moves.1. e3 e5 2. d3 d5: He's letting me gain centre control maybe to launch a side attack later
moves.3. Ne2: He opts for Ne2 rather than Nf3...
moves.4. h3: Doesnt want me pinning his Knight
moves.6. g3: Unusual fiancetto coming up?  I'd never encountered this type before except in our previous game (this was a rematch where I won the first).
moves.6... Be6: I don't always play like this but it seemed appropriate
moves.7. Bg2: There's the fiancetto...Has anyone else seen this played?
moves.9... Ne7: That moment where there's nowhere else to go cuz all the pieces have been developed..
moves.10... c5: The purpose of me pulling back the Knight
moves.11... Qc8: Time to reinforce + launch an attack K-side
moves.12... h5: I haven't finished yet! Compromising my own k- side for a good offense
moves.13. f4: He fights back but im not sure about this move being a good idea ..
moves.13... Nc6: Returns to defending position to protect e pawn
moves.14. e4: Now he wants my centre position!
moves.14... d4: His dark square bishop can't really do anything useful now and I conveniently get out of a pawn exchange
moves.15. f5: Blocking k-side entry and attacking my bish
moves.15... Bd7: Only safe place for the bishop
moves.16. Ng1: Hmmmm... I would have placed Knight at c4 attacking other bishop
moves.17. Bf3: Trying to attack the lone h pawn
moves.20. fxg6: This works for me as now his h pawn is vulnerable ...
moves.20... fxg6 21. Nb1: He is preparing to add the dsb to the greenzone
moves.22. Bg5 Nd8: Adding the Knight to the fire soon
moves.23. Qe2 Nf7: To get rid of the dsb
moves.24. Bxf6+: He chooses to capture rather than retreat
moves.25. Qf2: He intends to make use of the f file
moves.25... Ra6: My rook is ready to come into play
moves.26... Rxh5: Its interesting that my attack on his k-side has left my own k-side quite skeletal
moves.27. g4: He realised his h pawn was again vulnerable
moves.27... Rh7: The best move as ...Rh6? would lead to g5 and then he would get my Knight and get into my kings territory . Not going to happen!
moves.28. Qg3: Not good -what about strong f file?
moves.28... Bg5: Preventing g5. Safe as f file is not under pressure anymore
moves.30. Qe1: He would have benefitted more from Qf2, IMO ..
moves.31... g5: No turning back for the bish! Opening up the 6th rank
moves.32... Rah6: Despite my king being out in the open he has no real counterattack and now I've got a heavily armed h file
moves.33. Qg1: Don't know why he does this
moves.35... Rg3+: The king must step aside from his lady!
moves.36. Kf2 Rxg1: If he takes with the Knight he loses the other Knight but it is better than taking with the rook...
moves.37... Be3+: 37...Be3!! At this point he resigns as he will lose his rook and I will have the advantage to compose a quick win. Hope you enjoyed the annotation! :D
